Reviews.Title: Piece of junk
Reviews.Author: D. Sullens
Reviews.Content: DO NOT spend money on this phone!First, it uses the Sprint network. That means spotty coverage and intermittent service. At my home, it worked about half the time, and I live in Fort Worth, Texas. Straight Talk rep promised to add days to my plan to compensate, but that never happened.Then, six weeks after I bought the phone, it would no longer charge the battery with either the AC or car charger. Obviously a problem with the phone and/or battery.I moved to a Samsung Galaxy Centura. It is served by Verizon. So far, dependable service and I'm delighted with the phone itself.The salesperson at WalMart said Motorola made/makes good basic phones but, when it comes to smartphones, just simply "doesn't get it."Sounds right to me!

Reviews.Title: The Motorola Defy
Reviews.Author: Alleen G.
Reviews.Content: I like the phone very much..although I had difficulty with the touch screen keyboard. I think it was because my fingers were to big..NOT because it wasnt a nice phone.
